dialogue: Okay. You ready?
It's beautiful. Thank you. It would've been a lot for me.
Of course they're early.
Bed rest is great. I can't go anywhere. Or do anything. But really, I'm fine. I can't wait to be a Mom, but I miss my kids. If all goes well, I'll be back at school full-time next fall.
Hope you came hungry. There's beer in the cooler.
Hey, Mikey. You almost have it. Remember. Point, Push and Pull. You got this kid.
I see a lacrosse title in our future, boys. Whatever you're feeding those sons of yours, it's working.
I'm good, thanks.
Who you texting? Everyone’s here?
It’s just somebody interested in the 4Runner.

I was thinking the other day about this woman who turned me down twenty￾six times before she agreed to a date. We met at dusk down on River Street and did one of those "penny walks" where you flip a coin at the end of each block. Heads you go left, tails you go right. Over the next few hours we saw the whole city, talking and laughing, and at the end of the evening I couldn't help myself... I asked her the question that had been burning in my mind all night: "What made you change your mind? Why'd you finally say yes?"
And she says: "I had to know what kind of guy asks someone out twenty￾seven times."
"So...?" I asked. "What's the verdict?" Do you remember what you said?
"You're the kind of guy who forgets his wallet on a first date and is too scared to tell me."
I was terrified. All I had was the change in my pocket so I'd improvised. But it was the best night of my life. And three years later, here we are.

I'll be honest, Allison and I weren't sure about whether to have this party. But together there's nothing we can't overcome. You're the strongest woman I know and I love you more than anything. And I am so damn excited to keep building our life together.
Why don’t you ever say things like that to me?
Your vitamins are on the table.
Thanks. It was a good party.
You deserve it.
You're just buttering me up before you abandon me.
I wish I could delay it again. I don't like leaving you here.
I'm not an invalid. Just tell the Judge something wildly inappropriate and come back to me.
Deal.
Sorry!
Hey.
How'd it go?
I got picked.
What happened to wildly inappropriate?
I'm saving that for you. They said it'll be a short trial.
Mmm hmm. Now answer me this truly important question: What are we doing for dinner?
You're the boss. Any cravings?
Chinese?
Sounds good.
Hey. Sorry I'm late.
That's okay. How was the meeting?
Good. I stayed after to talk with Larry for a bit.
You sure you're all right?
I’m good.
It's all gonna be fine, babe.
We're gonna have a family.
We didn't make it this far last time.
How much longer is this trial gonna go on for?
I'm not sure.
Are you close to a verdict?
I'm not allowed to discuss that. It's ten-to-two for "guilty."
So Monday you go in there, sway the holdouts and voila.
I'm one of them.
Oh.
They took one look at this guy and that was it. No discussion of the evidence, nothing. I had to do something.
Of course.
Everyone deserves a chance, right? I keep thinking about where I'd be if you hadn't given me one...
Can I ask you something?
Sure.
If I were to sell the 4Runner without telling someone it was in a wreck -- but they’re happy with the deal and there's no safety risk 'cause we restored it --
I thought it was in the ad.
Just go with me. If they’re never the wiser and nobody gets hurt, did I do anything wrong?
If no one gets hurt, then no. I suppose not. Does that... help?
All right, then. I'm heading to bed. Dinner's in the fridge.
Thanks. I'll be up shortly.
Good night.
What's that?
My pitchfork.
About last night...
This case is really wearing on me.
I know. Just trust your gut. You'll do the right thing.
He's a giant.
It's been a couple years.
Crazy.
Yeah.
Whoa. Hey--
Whatcha doing?
Nothing. Just inspecting the car.
Where'd you hit that deer again? Brimstone Pass?
Yeah.
You sure it wasn't Old Quarry Road?
Positive.
That's exactly what I said when the prosecutor from your trial just interrogated me in our living room.
What...?
I looked her up. She wanted to know about your accident.
Why would she want to know about that?
She said she's looking into a possible hit and run.
Okay... And what did you tell her?
The truth. You hit a deer up on Brimstone Pass.
Good.
That is the truth, right...?
Ally...
You took the shortcut home through Old Quarry that night, didn't you?
Yeah.
You stop at Rowdy's Hideaway?
It was a one-time thing. I ordered a drink, but I didn't touch it.
Why should I believe that?
Because it's the truth. It was their due date. And I couldn't deal with it. The feelings I was having... I couldn't bring that into our home, to put that on you. So, I went somewhere else.
You could've talked to me.
No. You were in too much pain already. It crushes her to hear that. Tears welling now.
I was lost. I kept thinking that somehow I was responsible for what happened.
No...
They were my babies. And there it is. It was twins that they lost.
Ally...
We were both hurting. I'm still hurting.
Me, too.
But now we're about to have our family.
Yeah.
I can't lose you. I can't do this alone.
I'll protect our family. I promise.
What time does it start?
Soon. I should probably head out.
You sure you want to go?
He wasn't a good guy. It's not your fault.
I didn't stand up for him. I told them what they needed to hear and said he couldn't change.
I'll be back in a bit.
And the 4Runner is officially sold.
Get over here. We just started.
Yes, Ma'am. I love me some "tummy￾time."
I think she has my eyes.
Really? I think she has mine.
She has your elbows.
My mouth! She has my mouth.
Let's hope not.
My girls. It's perfect.
I'll get it.
